Rulings.Base:
1. Negating your opponent's Spell/Trap Card is a Quick Effect that can be used during either player's turn, doesn't target, and can be used during the Damage Step.
2. Sending 1 card from your hand to the GY is a cost.
3. You cannot negate the effect of an already face-up Continuous Spell or Trap Card.
4. You can negate a card that targets "T.G. Blade Blaster" along with other cards on the field.
5. You can activate the effect to negate a Spell/Trap Card more than once per turn and more than once in a single Chain.
6. You Chain the effect directly to the Spell/Trap you want to negate.
7. The effect to remove this card from play does not target, starts a Chain, and can be activated any time during your opponent's turn, except the Damage Step.
8. Removing 1 "T.G." monster from your GY is a cost.
9. Special Summoning this card starts a Chain and does not target.
